nodes.bodyText: @Scottmitch createUnresolved doesn't work when you pass an IP-address. I had to create a utility for this conversion.
nit: Rename to toUnresolvedAddress() to indicate it is unresolved?

Actually, it's a resolved address, we expect an IP instead of the host. toUnresolvedAddress name is misleading in the same way as InetSocketAddress.createUnresolved that doesn't work in this case, because it initializes InetSocketAddress.getHostName() instead of InetSocketAddress.getAddress().
aah rite .. can we use a name which indicates that it is resolved then?
Use loopback IPs instead of some specific IPs here and below?
